H0.text: Cholesterol is a type of molecule that helps the plasma membrane keep its shape.

H1.text: Proteins are the type of molecules that help the plasma membrane keep its shape.

H2.text: Magnesium is a type of molecule that helps the plasma membrane keep its shape.

H3.text: Metabolic molecules help the plasma membrane keep its shape.

A4.text: Cholesterol is normally found dispersed in varying degrees throughout cell membranes, in the irregular spaces between the hydrophobic tails of the membrane lipids, where it confers a stiffening and strengthening effect on the membrane.

A5.text: the plasma membrane also contains a large quantity of proteins, which provide more structure

A6.text: 3D structures of proteins associated with plasma membrane of eukaryotic cells
